meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a nipple or nipple-like projection
meanings.sent1: The papillary texture of the fabric felt bumpy like tiny nipples.
meanings.sent2: Her papillary skin had small raised bumps that resembled nipples.
meanings.sent3: The papillary clouds in the sky looked like fluffy nipples floating above.
meanings.sent4: The papillary pattern on the leaf was like a field of miniature nipples.
meanings.sent5: The papillary sensation was as soft and tender as a gentle touch on a nipple.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being a papilla
meanings.sent1: The papillary growth on the plant was small and delicate.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the papillary structure of the mushroom while hiking.
meanings.sent3: The papillary shape of the rock formation reminded him of tiny fingers.
meanings.sent4: The papillary appearance of the coral reef was like a garden of small bumps.
meanings.sent5: The papillary feeling under his fingertips was rough and uneven, like tiny hills.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or being a papilla of the dermis
meanings.sent1: The papillary layer of the skin provides support and nourishment.
meanings.sent2: She learned about the papillary structures in the skin during biology class.
meanings.sent3: The papillary cells in the body work together like a team of tiny builders.
meanings.sent4: The papillary network of blood vessels ensures proper circulation.
meanings.sent5: The papillary function of the skin is essential for maintaining temperature regulation.
